bioghist.p: Health PAC is the Health Policy Advisory Center of the Institute of Policy Studies. It began in mid-1967 as a result of concern for the state of urban health affairs in New York City. People felt the need for an advisory and technical assistance center for the general public and for all concerned groups wanting a more advanced and publicly accountable health service system. It served with an advisory center, a data center, a social analysis lab and development center, a technical assistance center, and a communications center.

scopecontent.p: The archives of Health PAC consist of subject files on all topics of health, reports on different hospitals in New York City and other urban locations, studies of health care systems in foreign countries, articles and reports on financial and medical accountability; information on national health institutes; Department of Health statistics; meeting minutes of various health care planning and advisory committees; bibliographic files; proposals; articles in rough draft; book reviews; position papers; pamphlets and flyers; newsletters and publications from community and national organizations; financial records; and correspondence. Major topics include free clinics, costs of medical care, insurance and HMOs, medical education, patients' rights, mental health, and aging.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
